title: England's World Cup match against France at risk of being cancelled by super typhoon
text:
England’s final Pool C match against France is now in danger of being cancelled by the super typhoon that had initially threatened Ireland’s match in Fukuoka against Samoa but is now forecast to make landfall in Tokyo.

The typhoon, called Hagibis, escalated on Tuesday from a tropical storm into a Category 5 super typhoon with winds estimated at 160mph, one of the most dramatic intensifications of any tropical cyclone since records began and the latest forecast was for it to hit Tokoyo and Yokohama this weekend.

Any games cancelled due to weather problems are registered as scoreless draws and would have no impact on the final standings as England and France have already qualified for the quarter-finals....
description: England’s final Pool C match against France is now in danger of being cancelled by the super typhoon that had initially threatened Ireland’s match in Fukuoka against Samoa but is now forecast to make landfall in Tokyo.
